intro: Barleria prionitis subsp. pubiflora, commonly known as the hairy-flowered barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces, and its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or red. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. The subspecies is distinguished by its pubescent (hairy) floral bracts, which give it its common name.
